heading: Deaths
txt: Antonin Magne, French cyclist (b. 1904)

entities.title: Antonin Magne
entities.description: Antonin Magne was a French cyclist who won the Tour de France in 1931 and 1934. He raced as a professional from 1927 to 1939 and then became a team manager. The French rider and then journalist, Jean Bobet, described him in Sporting Cyclist as "a most uninterviewable character" and "a man who withdraws into a shell as soon as he meets a journalist." His taciturn character earned him the nickname o

heading: Deaths
txt: John Franklin Enders, American virologist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1887)

entities.title: John Franklin Enders
entities.description: John Franklin Enders was an American biomedical scientist and Nobel Laureate. Enders has been called "The Father of Modern Vaccines."

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is awarded yearly by the Nobel Assembly at the Karolinska Institutet for outstanding discoveries in physiology or medicine.

heading: Deaths
txt: Denys Watkins-Pitchford, English author and illustrator (b. 1905)

entities.title: Denys Watkins-Pitchford
entities.description: Denys James Watkins-Pitchford MBE was a British naturalist, an illustrator and a children's author under the pseudonym "BB". He won the 1942 Carnegie Medal for British children's books.

heading: Deaths
txt: Alex North, American composer and conductor (b. 1910)

entities.title: Alex North
entities.description: Alex North was an American composer best known for his many film scores, including A Streetcar Named Desire, Viva Zapata!, Spartacus, Cleopatra, and Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? He was the first composer to receive an Honorary Academy Award, but never won a competitive Oscar despite fourteen nominations.

heading: Deaths
txt: Derek Taylor, English journalist and author (b. 1932)

entities.title: Derek Taylor
entities.description: Derek Taylor was an English journalist, writer, publicist and record producer. He is best known for his role as press officer to the Beatles, with whom he worked in 1964 and then from 1968 to 1970, and was one of several associates to earn the moniker "the Fifth Beatle". Before returning to London to head the publicity for the Beatles' Apple Corps organisation in 1968, he worked as the publicist f

heading: Deaths
txt: Moondog, American-German singer-songwriter, drummer, and poet (b. 1916)

entities.title: Moondog
entities.description: Louis Thomas Hardin, also known as Moondog, was an American musician, composer, theoretician, poet and inventor of several musical instruments. He was blind from the age of 16.

heading: Deaths
txt: Michalis Kounelis, Greek violinist (b. 1928)

heading: Deaths
txt: Bill Ricker, Canadian entomologist and author (b. 1908)

entities.title: Bill Ricker
entities.description: William Edwin Ricker, is an important founder of fisheries science. He is best known for the Ricker model, which he developed in his studies of stock and recruitment in fisheries. The model can be used to predict the number of fish that will be present in a fishery. He also had an international standing as an entomologist and a scientific editor. He published 296 papers and books, 238 translations

heading: Deaths
txt: Laurie Williams, Jamaican cricketer (b. 1968)

entities.title: Laurie Williams (cricketer)
entities.description: Laurie Rohan Williams was a West Indian cricketer. Williams was 33 years old when he died; a car he was driving crashed into an oncoming bus.

heading: Deaths
txt: Leni Riefenstahl, German actress, director, producer, and screenwriter (b. 1902)

entities.title: Leni Riefenstahl
entities.description: Helene Bertha Amalie "Leni" Riefenstahl was a German film director, photographer, and actress, known for her seminal role in producing Nazi propaganda.

heading: Deaths
txt: Frank Thomas, American animator, voice actor, and screenwriter (b. 1913)

entities.title: Frank Thomas (animator)
entities.description: Franklin Rosborough "Frank" Thomas was an American animator and pianist. He was one of Walt Disney's leading team of animators known as the Nine Old Men.

heading: Deaths
txt: Noel Cantwell, Irish cricketer, footballer, and manager (b. 1932)

entities.title: Noel Cantwell
entities.description: Noel Euchuria Cornelius Cantwell was an Irish soccer player and sometime cricketer born in Cork, County Cork, Ireland. He was educated at the Roman Catholic Presentation Brothers College in Cork.

heading: Deaths
txt: Donald Horne, Australian journalist, author, and critic (b. 1921)

heading: Deaths
txt: Hilda Bernstein, English-South African author and activist (b. 1915)

entities.title: Hilda Bernstein
entities.description: Hilda Bernstein was a British-born author, artist, and an activist against apartheid and for women's rights.

heading: Deaths
txt: Peter Brock, Australian race car driver and sportscaster (b. 1945)

heading: Deaths
txt: Vincent Serventy, Australian ornithologist, conservationist, and author (b. 1916)

entities.title: Vincent Serventy
entities.description: Vincent Noel Serventy AM was an Australian author, ornithologist and conservationist.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ralph Plaisted, American explorer (b. 1927)

entities.title: Ralph Plaisted
entities.description: Ralph Summers Plaisted and his three companions, Walt Pederson, Gerry Pitzl and Jean-Luc Bombardier, are regarded by most polar authorities to be the first to succeed in a surface traverse across the ice to the North Pole on 19 April 1968, making the first confirmed surface conquest of the Pole.

heading: Deaths
txt: Aage Bohr, Danish physicist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1922)

entities.title: Aage Bohr
entities.description: Aage Niels Bohr was a Danish nuclear physicist who shared the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1975 with Ben Mottelson and James Rainwater "for the discovery of the connection between collective motion and particle motion in atomic nuclei and the development of the theory of the structure of the atomic nucleus based on this connection". Starting from Rainwater's concept of an irregular-shaped liquid drop

entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physics is a yearly award given by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences for those who have made the most outstanding contributions for mankind in the field of physics. heading: Deaths
txt: Mike Bongiorno, American-Italian television host (b. 1924)

heading: Deaths
txt: Ronald Hamowy, Canadian historian and academic (b. 1937)

entities.title: Ronald Hamowy
entities.description: Ronald Hamowy was a Canadian academic, known primarily for his contributions to political and social academic fields. At the time of his death, he was professor emeritus of Intellectual History at the University of Alberta in Edmonton, Canada. Hamowy was closely associated with the political ideology of libertarianism and his writings and scholarship place particular emphasis on individual liberty

heading: Deaths
txt: Bill Moggridge, English-American designer, author, and educator, co-founded IDEO (b. 1943)

entities.title: IDEO
entities.description: IDEO is a design and consulting firm with offices in the U.S., England, Germany, Japan, and China. It was founded in Palo Alto, California, in 1991. The company uses the design thinking approach to design products, services, environments, and digital experiences.

heading: Deaths
txt: Thomas Szasz, Hungarian-American psychiatrist and academic (b. 1920)

heading: Deaths
txt: Goose Gonsoulin, American football player (b. 1938)

entities.title: Goose Gonsoulin
entities.description: Austin William "Goose" Gonsoulin was an American professional football player who was a safety in the American Football League (AFL) for the Denver Broncos and in the National Football League (NFL) for the San Francisco 49ers. Gonsoulin played college football at Baylor University.

txt: Don Reichert, Canadian painter and photographer (b. 1932)

txt: Jean Véronis, French linguist, computer scientist, and blogger (b. 1955)

txt: Marvin Barnes, American basketball player (b. 1952)

entities.title: Marvin Barnes
entities.description: Marvin Jerome "Bad News" Barnes was an American professional basketball player. A forward, he was an All-American at Providence College, and played professionally in both the American Basketball Association (ABA) and National Basketball Association (NBA).

heading: Deaths
txt: S. Truett Cathy, American businessman, founded Chick-fil-A (b. 1921)

entities.title: Chick-fil-A
entities.description: Chick-fil-A is one of the largest American fast food restaurant chains and the largest whose specialty is chicken sandwiches. Its headquarters is in College Park, Georgia. Chick-fil-A was originally founded as the Dwarf Grill in 1946, changing the name to Dwarf House until rebranding as Chick-fil-A in 1967. txt: Sean O'Haire, American wrestler, mixed martial artist, and kick-boxer (b. 1971)

entities.description: Joaquín Andújar was a Dominican professional baseball pitcher who played in Major League Baseball (MLB) for the Houston Astros, St. Louis Cardinals, and Oakland Athletics from 1976 through 1988. Andújar was a four-time MLB All-Star and a Gold Glove Award winner.
